New Records: David Willey completed 100 wickets in ODIs
Key Match Events: Pakistan were ALL OUT at 244 in 43.3 overs, disqualified from World Cup semis' race
Ben Stokes and Joe Root played a 132-run partnership to power England to 337/9 runs after 50 overs
Jonny Bairstow and Dawid Malan started well and provided England with an 82-run opening partnership
Spinner Iftikhar Ahmed ended the strong partnership as he clinched Dawid Malan's wicket and Joe Root is the new batter on crease
Haris Rauf delivered a beautiful ball to dismiss Jonny Bairstow
Ben Stokes played wonderfully for England today before he was dismissed by a fiery delivery of Shaheen Afridi
Chris Woakes brought back into attack by England. Wasim and Rauf are on crease. WICKET!! Chris Woakes dismisses Haris Rauf and Pakistan were ALL OUT at 244 in 43.3 over
David Willey continues with his attack. Wasim and Rauf are on crease. Haris Rauf hits the first and the third deliveries for 4s, while Wasim slams the fifth balls for boundary
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan needs to defeat England by 287 runs while batting first or 284 balls to spare while chasing in order to think about the semi-finals

Jos Buttler-led England has been a disaster in the ICC World Cup 2020, but in their previous match against the Netherlands, the team has shown the potential of defending champions and will definitely make Pakistan's job more difficult as their Champions Trophy 2025 qualifications depend on today's victory
Post-Match Reflections: England has qualified for Champions Trophy
Pakistan now get disqualified from World Cup semis' race
David Willey was chosen as 'Player of the Match'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The England vs Pakistan match is scheduled at the pitch of Eden Gardens, Kolkata which is known to support batters with a flat surface
There is a 1% chance of rains over the Eden Gardens during the match hours while the temperature is expected to range between 21 to 32 degrees Celsius
Others: In the One Day Internationals (ODI) format of the game, England and Pakistan faced each other in 91 matches and the Jos Buttler-led side dominated the game with 56 wins
In their last World Cup match, Pakistan defeated England by 14 runs
